instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What do schedule values other than 0 denote for the supply air fan?
output: They denote that the supply fan runs continuously while the heating or cooling coil cycles to meet the load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is Zone Ideal Loads Supply Air Total Heating Energy?
output: The total (sensible and latent) heating energy (or rate) added to raise the mixed air stream to the temperature and humidity ratio of the supply air stream. Zone Ideal Loads Supply Air Total Heating Energy is metered as DistrictHeatingWater energy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the Tank Object Type field contain?
output: This alpha (choice) field contains the type of water heater tank used by this heat pump water heater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> listing
input: Provide an example of a 'Pump:ConstantSpeed' object.
output: Pump:ConstantSpeed Circ Pump !- Name CW Supply Inlet Node !- Inlet Node Name PumpChiller Node !- Outlet Node Name 0.0011 !- Design Flow Rate 300000 !- Design Pump Head 700 !- Design Power Consumption 0.87 !- Motor Efficiency 0.0 !- Fraction of Motor Inefficiencies to Fluid Stream Intermittent; !- Pump Control Type

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What is the input for the 'Field: Month Temperature(s) -- 12 fields in all' for deep ground temperatures?
output: Each numeric field is the monthly deep ground temperature (degrees Celsius) used for the indicated month (January = 1st field February = 2nd field etc.)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the Availability Schedule Name for the three-speed cooling coil?
output: FanAndCoilAvailSched

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does a value of zero in the 'Field: Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate' specify?
output: It specifies no outdoor air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How is the starting corner for a surface specified for underground walls?
output: The rectangular surfaces specify the lower left corner of the surface for their starting coordinate. This is specified with (xyz) and can be relative to the zone origin or in world coordinates depending on the value for rectangular surfaces specified in the GlobalGeometryRules object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> table row: Convection Coefficient Assignment Hierarchy
input: What convection model is used for BlockenWindard?
output: Outside

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the general rule for the month the storm window is put on and taken off in the northern hemisphere?
output: In the northern hemisphere the month the storm window is put on is generally greater than the month it is taken off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: For what range should the curve be valid?
output: The curve should be valid for the range of part-load ratios anticipated for the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: What is the typical maximum value for the 'Evaporative Operation Maximum Limit Wetbulb Temperature'?
output: The typical maximum value is 24 degrees Celsius.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the Water to Air Heat Pump latent heating energy calculated?
output: This value is calculated as the difference between the total energy delivered to the zone and the sensible energy delivered to the zone by the WaterToAirHP heat pump.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Schedules -> text
input: How might a theater or playhouse use custom day schedules?
output: A theater/playhouse may only have occupancy during certain weeks of the year and/or certain hours of certain days. CustomDay1 and/or CustomDay2 can be used to set the significant occupancy lighting and other schedules for the custom days and use unoccupied values for the normal weekdays.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: In what order are the Availability Managers executed?
output: The Availability Managers are executed in Availability Manager List order.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What does the field 'Electric Circuit Node Name' indicate?
output: This named node contains where the electric power is put in the program simulation for use by the electric equipment in the Load Center.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: How will the components in the AirLoopHVAC:OutdoorAirSystem:EquipmentList be simulated?
output: The components will be simulated in the order in which they occur in the list.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What is the OperativeTemperature option?
output: The OperativeTemperature option controls the radiant system using the operative temperature which is the average of Mean Air Temperature and Mean Radiant Temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> table or table row: Outputs
input: What is the output variable for the Plant System Cycle On Off Status?
output: HVACAveragePlant System Cycle On Off Status []

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

output: It represents the minimum time that windows will remain open.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group ExternalInterface -> text
input: What should work with version 7.0 or later when using EP-Launch?
output: A relative path or a simple file name should work with version 7.0 or later when using EP-Launch.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text
input: What should be done if there are no air exhaust nodes?
output: If there are no air exhaust nodes this field should be blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Minimum Flow Rate Fraction' specify?
output: The numeric field specifies the minimum flow allowed for the pump bank as a fraction of the nominal flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What do the two fields along with the minimum and maximum number of warmup days define?
output: They define the user specified criteria for when EnergyPlus will \converge\ at each environment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the name of the curve for Speed 4 Heating Capacity Function of Water Flow Fraction?
output: Heating VS WaterFrac Test

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the curve for 'Speed <x> Heating Capacity Function of Air Flow Fraction Curve Name' normalized?
output: The curve is normalized to have the value of 1.0 when the actual air flow rate equals the design air flow rate at Speed <x>.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the design minimum exhaust temperature?
output: The design minimum exhaust temperature is 150°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: Is the diffuse-diffuse transmittance assumed to be the same for both sides of the glazing?
output: The diffuse-diffuse transmittance is assumed to be the same for both sides of the glazing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is electric energy consumption modeled at temperatures away from the rating point?
output: The result of this curve is multiplied by the inverse of the Cooling Only Mode Rated COP to model electric energy consumption at temperatures away from the rating point.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: When is Fan:ConstantVolume used in the unitary equipment?
output: Fan:ConstantVolume is used when the Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule values are never 0 and the fan operates continuously.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What output variable measures the electricity for plant in joules?
output: ZoneMeterElectricity:Plant [J]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: How is the Site Solar Azimuth Angle measured?
output: The Solar Azimuth Angle (f) is measured from the North (clockwise) and is expressed in degrees.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: How is the evaporation loss calculated with the LossFactor mode?
output: The evaporation loss is calculated as a fraction of the circulating condenser water flow and varies with the temperature change in the condenser water.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the default value for the design heating discharge air temperature?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: This field is used to indicate if the packaged TES coil includes a mode with both cooling at the coil and charging of the TES tank at the same time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the starved storage tank water volume indicate?
output: These are the rate and volume of water the Storage Tank connections was not able to provide.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What are the minimum and maximum values for the 'Minimum Outdoor Temperature Schedule'?
output: The minimum temperature value in the schedule can be -100°C and the maximum value can be 100°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 2 Reference Unit Gross Cooling COP?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: A value less than or equal to 0 (usually 0 is used) denotes that the unit must be off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text

output: The Coil Flow Ratio tells how quickly the efficiency of the stage would decrease with a mismatch of the supply and secondary flows.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

output: The default value is 0.02.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: ZoneHVAC:ForcedAir:UserDefined -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> equation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table: Design Objects and Their Parameters

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

output: The minimum temperature difference value in the schedule can be -100°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> listing

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> table

output: The outputs listed are: HVACAverageFan Electricity Rate [W] HVACAverageFan Rise in Air Temperature [deltaC] HVACSumFan Electricity Energy [J].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> equation
input: What is the formula for Mixing Latent Gain?
output: Mixing Latent Gain = (Mixing Latent Gain during on cycle * Run time fraction) + Mixing Latent Gain during off cycle * (1.0 -- Run time fraction)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the VRF system is in heating mode and recovers heat?
output: If the VRF system is in heating mode and recovers heat then that amount of heat was recovered from terminal units in zone(s) requiring cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> table
input: Provide an example of an IDF input for AirflowNetwork:IntraZone:Node.
output: AirflowNetwork:IntraZone:Node  LeftUpper        !- Name  LeftUpper        !- RoomAir:Node:AirflowNetwork Name  NORTH_ZONE       !- Zone Name  4.572;          !- Node Height m

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text

output: This field specifies the type of spectrum data. Choices are Solar and Visible.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

input: What is the output variable for Zone Sum Zone Lights Electricity Energy?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Inputs -> text

output: The 'Field: Availability Schedule Name' specifies the schedule that denotes whether the high temperature radiant system can operate during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> table row: Relationship of Angles (degrees) to Time

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

output: This field contains the schedule value that is used during the warm-up period and during the system sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What happens if space heat balance is active and a space name is specified for Zone or Space Name?
output: If space heat balance is active and a space name is specified for Zone or Space Name then the space conditions will be used and the exchange will be with that space only.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Condenser Minimum Flow Fraction' field correspond to?
output: It corresponds to the minimum condenser flow fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Coefficient for Local Dynamic Loss Due to fitting' in the AirflowNetwork duct component?
output: This numeric field is defined as a coefficient for dynamic loss [dimensionless]. It represents dynamic loss due to fittings (such as an elbow).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Control -> text
input: What is expected after the keyword and identifying name in the outdoor operation objects?
output: After the keyword and identifying name a series of data trios is expected consisting of a lower limit an upper limit and a name that links to an equipment availability list.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the output of the curve multiplied by for 'Heating Capacity Function of Air Flow Fraction Curve Name'?
output: The output of this curve is multiplied by the rated heating capacity and the heating capacity modifier curve (function of temperature) to give the DX coil heating capacity at the specific inlet fluid temperatures and air flow rate at which the coil is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text
input: Where must the AvailabilityManager:DifferentialThermostat object be placed in the availability manager list?
output: The AvailabilityManager:DifferentialThermostat object must always be the last manager in the availability manager list.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How is the design generation rate determined in the cutoff model?
output: The design generation rate in the cutoff model is the maximum amount of generic contaminant expected at design conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: How does the system recover during the transition to heat recovery mode?
output: The system will recover according to the time constant entered in the Heat Recovery Heating Capacity Time Constant input field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Tube Outside Diameter' describe?
output: The outside diameter (m) of the tubes.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What does the field 'Number of Compressors' define?
output: This numeric field defines the number of compressors in the VRF system condensing unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList in the unit heater object?
output: The AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList is an optional input in the unit heater object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What determines the amount of outdoor ventilation air entering the controlled zone?
output: The amount of outdoor ventilation air entering the controlled zone is determined as air from outdoors and not from other adjacent zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the 'Field: On-Cycle Parasitic Fuel Type' specify?
output: The type of fuel used by the on-cycle parasitics.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How is 'Zone Opaque Surface Inside Faces Total Conduction Heat Gain Rate' calculated in the example with values 100 -200 400 50 150 and -300 W?
output: Zone Opaque Surface Inside Faces Total Conduction Heat Gain Rate = 700 - 500 = 200 W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the Earth Tube dimensionless boundary below?
output: The Earth Tube dimensionless boundary below is 0.5.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> itemize
input: What are some of the usual window and surface variables relevant for the upper window?
output: ZoneAverageSurface Outside Face Sunlit Area [m2]; ZoneAverageSurface Outside Face Sunlit Fraction []; ZoneAverageSurface Outside Face Incident Solar Radiation Rate per Area[W/m2]; ZoneAverageSurface Outside Face Incident Beam Solar Radiation Rate per Area[W/m2]; ZoneAverageSurface Outside Face Incident Sky Diffuse Solar Radiation Rate per Area[W/m2]; ZoneAverageSurface Outside Face Incident Ground Diffuse Solar Radiation Rate per Area[W/m2]; ZoneAverageSurface Outside Face Beam Solar Incident Angle Cosine Value[]; ZoneAverageSurface Window Transmitted Solar Radiation Rate [W]; ZoneAverageSurface Window Total Glazing Layers Absorbed Solar Radiation Rate [W]; ZoneAverageSurface Window Heat Gain Rate [W]; ZoneAverageSurface Window Heat Loss Rate [W].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What was a previous requirement of EnergyPlus regarding interzone surfaces?
output: Previously this was a requirement of EnergyPlus (prior to version 2.0) but now it is optional and the user also has the option of only defining the surface once (EnergyPlus defines the second surface automatically within the program).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Night Venting Flow Fraction' specify?
output: The fraction (could be greater than 1) of the design flow rate at which the night ventilation will be done.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What are the two options available for 'Blowdown Calculation Mode'?
output: The two options are `ConcentrationRatio` or `ScheduledRate`.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the unit for Zone Thermal Comfort Pierce Model Discomfort Index?
output: Zone Thermal Comfort Pierce Model Discomfort Index is dimensionless [].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> table row: Space or Zone Zone Air Heat Balance Internal Convective Heat Gain Constituents
input: What is the convective heat gain type for 'Lights' in the table?
output: The convective heat gain type for 'Lights' is 'Lights'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the typical difference between actual volume and nominal volume for water heaters?
output: Actual volume is almost always 10% lower for electric water heaters and 5% lower for gas water heaters.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What do schedule values less than or equal to zero indicate for a scheduled on availability manager?
output: Schedule values less than or equal to zero (usually 0 is used) denote that NoAction is desired.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: How can the zone minimum supply air flow be further adjusted in a VAV system?
output: The zone minimum supply air flow can be further adjusted using scheduled fraction values specified in the field Minimum Air Flow Turndown Schedule Name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What will establish the maximum heat addition to the pool?
output: The maximum water volumetric flow rate along with the pool setpoint temperature and the heating plant equipment outlet temperature will establish the maximum heat addition to the pool.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What is the soil specific heat?
output: The soil specific heat is 836 J/kg-K.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Path -> text
input: How is the 'Field: Inlet <#> Node Name' object extensible?
output: This object is extensible so additional fields of this type can be added to the end of this object. (Note that some EnergyPlus editing tools may allow only 500 inlet node names.)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What are the constraints for the 'Rated Evaporator Inlet Air Dry-Bulb Temperature' field?
output: Values must be greater than 5°C. If this field is left blank the default value is 19.7°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What are the input options for the Field: Carbon Dioxide Concentration?
output: Input is Yes or No. The default is No.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the Field: Pipe Thermal Conductivity contain?
output: This numeric field contains the thermal conductivity of the pipe in W/m-K.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: Where is the temperature sensor located in relation to the pump in the constant flow system?
output: The temperature sensor is located after the pump to ensure proper inlet temperature to the radiant system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: When are names in the High-Stage Compressor or CompressorList Name field valid?
output: Names are valid only if two compressor stages have been specified in the 'Number of Compressor Stages' field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the rated water heating capacity for the Coil:WaterHeating:AirToWaterHeatPump:VariableSpeed object?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What does NF stand for in the equation?
output: NF = Normalized condenser water flow per unit of tower capacity m3/s-W

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the output field report for the Water to Air Heat Pump latent heating rate?
output: This output field is the latent heat addition (humidification) rate of the Water to Air Heat Pump to the zone it is serving in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the 'Coefficient4 x**3' in a cubic curve?
output: The cubic coefficient (C4) in the equation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What are the minimum and maximum values for the Maximum Indoor Temperature field?
output: The minimum value for this field is -100.0°C and the maximum value is 100.0°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What happens if the name of a zone is entered in the ElectricLoadCenter:Storage:Converter model?
output: If the name of a zone is entered the power conversion losses will be added to the zone as internal heat gains.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table: HVACTemplate:Plant:Tower
input: What is the free convection capacity for HVACTemplate:Plant:Tower?
output: Free Convection Capacity

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the 'Minimum Hot Water or Steam Flow Rate' field used for?
output: It is used to set the minimum design hot water or steam volumetric flow rate in m³/s for the hot water or steam heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Baseboard Radiant Heating Energy' field report?
output: This field reports the amount of radiant energy transferred from the baseboard to the zone in Joules.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/

output: Suggested values are shown in Figure: Suggested values for maximum cycling rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is COP defined?
output: COP is the total cooling power output in watts divided by the electric power input in watts and is dimensionless.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is described in the model regarding the beams and units?
output: In this model it is only the total length of all the beams and the total air flow of all the units that are described not the number of individual beam units.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Back Side Drape Diffuse-Diffuse Visible Reflectance'?
output: The default value is 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Schedules -> text

output: The basic week schedule is shown next.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: Can beam-diffuse transmittance and reflectance and emissivity properties be different for the front and back side of the shade?
output: Yes beam-diffuse transmittance and reflectance and emissivity properties can be different for the front and back side of the shade.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What should the part load fraction correlation be normalized to?
output: The part load fraction correlation should be normalized to a value of 1.0 when the part load ratio equals 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

output: It is specified separately using the EnergyPlus Curve Manager.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the 'Surface Inside Face Initial Transmitted Diffuse Transmitted Out Window Solar Radiation Rate' describe?
output: It describes the diffuse solar transmitted through exterior windows that is initially distributed to another window in the zone and transmitted out of the zone through the inside face of the window.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Heating Coil Crankcase Heater Electricity Rate [W] indicate?
output: This is the average electricity consumption rate of the DX coil compressor's crankcase heater in Watts for the timestep being reported. When a companion cooling coil exists the crankcase heater power of the companion cool coil is also reported in this variable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> list

output: HVACSumZone Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner Latent Cooling Energy [J]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text

output: The centroid of each surface and zone ceiling height are used to automatically assign Zeta values within the program.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

output: The runtime operating ratio for the compressor is referred to as the Refrigeration Compressor Runtime Fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: Below the low temperature the capacity is set at the low capacity value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What additional objects are required for the correct specification of the packaged terminal heat pump?
output: The correct specification of the packaged terminal heat pump requires the following objects in addition to the compound object itself: Fan (Fan:OnOff or Fan:ConstantVolume) DX cooling coil (Coil:Cooling:DX:SingleSpeed or CoilSystem:Cooling:DX:HeatExchangerAssisted) DX heating coil (Coil:Heating:DX:SingleSpeed) Supplemental heating coil (Coil:Heating:Fuel or Coil:Heating:Electric) OutdoorAir:Mixer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

output: The name of the first air chiller that will be used to meet the zone cooling load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

output: This field is autosizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text

output: The EnergyPlus furnace is a virtual component that consists of a fan component (OnOff or ConstantVolume) and a Gas or Electric heating coil component.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Plant-Condenser Flow Control -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

Additionally coefficients 2 3 and 6 should not be used unless sufficient temperature data is available to accurately define the performance curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

output: The inlet node for the second evaporative cooler should be the same as the outlet node for the first evaporative cooler.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What assumption is made if the supply air fan operating mode schedule name field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the model assumes the supply air fan cycles with the heating or cooling coil throughout the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the Ice Thermal Storage On Coil Fraction?
output: The fraction of ice that is actually on the freezing surface at the end of the timestep. This can be different for an 'inside melt' system than the end fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the resistive defrost heater capacity for the COIL:Heating:DX:SingleSpeed?
output: The resistive defrost heater capacity is 20000 W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is Zone Ventilation Total Heat Gain Energy?
output: The total heat gain that occurs when the sum of Zone Ventilation Sensible Heat Gain Energy and Zone Ventilation Latent Heat Gain Energy is greater than or equal to the sum of Zone Ventilation Sensible Heat Loss Energy and Zone Ventilation Latent Heat Loss Energy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: Describe the CrankNicholsonSecondOrder scheme.
output: The CrankNicholsonSecondOrder scheme is second order in time and may be faster. But it can be unstable over time when boundary conditions change abruptly and severely.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Python Plugins / Python EMS -> text
input: What does EnergyPlus need to know once it initiates a Python process?
output: Once EnergyPlus initiates a Python process it will need to know where to search for user-defined plugin script files.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What happens when a zone requires outdoor air higher than the specified Zone Maximum Outdoor Air Fraction?
output: The zone supply air flow will be increased to cap the outdoor air fraction at the maximum value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the Cooling Tower Heat Transfer Rate represent?
output: This is the rate at which heat is removed from the condenser water loop by the tower.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

output: Simplifying calculations using internal mass must be used with caution when the FullInteriorAndExterior or FullInteriorAndExteriorWithReflections Solar Distribution model is chosen.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Cooling Panel Total System Cooling Rate [W]' field represent?
output: It represents the total rate of cooling achieved by the radiant cooling panel in Watts including convective heat transfer and decreased convection from zone surfaces.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Indoor Unit Evaporating Temperature Function of Superheating Curve Name' define?
output: This alpha field defines the name of a quadratic performance curve that parameterizes the variation of indoor unit evaporating temperature as a function of superheating degrees.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the nominal capacity of the Coil:Heating:Electric?
output: The nominal capacity is autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What is the condition for carbon dioxide (CO2) control?
output: If the zone CO2 level is above the setpoint the program will check the HVAC system availability first. If available HVAC operation will be allowed and natural ventilation is shut off. If the system is not available the natural ventilation will be allowed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What model does EnergyPlus use by default to calculate clear sky emissivity?
output: By default EnergyPlus calculates clear sky emissivity using the Clark-Allen model.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

output: Using Venting Availability Schedule allows you to turn off venting at certain times of the day week or year.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

output: This numeric field is used to input hydraulic diameter of a coil's air path.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What conditions trigger shading in the 'OnIfHighOutdoorAirTempAndHighHorizontalSolar' control type?
output: Shading is on if the outside air temperature exceeds the Setpoint (C) and if the horizontal solar radiation exceeds SetPoint 2 (W/m²).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the part-load ratio defined?
output: Part-load ratio is defined as the water removal load to be met (kg/s) divided by the dehumidifier's water removal rate (kg/s) at the current operating conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Energy Management System (EMS) -> text

output: The BeginTimestepBeforePredictor calling point is useful for controlling components that affect the thermal loads that the systems will be attempting to meet.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Inputs -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text

output: This field contains a unique name for the inverter. The name entered must also be unique across all other types of inverters that may also be in the input file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text

output: The second parameter describes the temperature difference between the mean and the point where system air is being extracted from the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> listing

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How can the waste heat be used during dehumidification operation?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
