output: Deposition surface area [m^2]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How is the heat from steam equipment divided in EnergyPlus?
output: It is divided into four different fractions: Fraction Latent Fraction Radiant Fraction Lost and the fraction of heat convected to the zone air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Superheating' contain?
output: This numeric field contains the estimated parameter superheat at the evaporator outlet in °C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Energy Management System (EMS) -> text
input: What unit is used for the EnergyTransfer meter?
output: The EnergyTransfer meter uses Joules [J] as its unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: How is the coil controlled according to the Convergence Tolerance field?
output: The coil is controlled by knowing the zone demand determined by the zone thermostat and setting the outlet conditions to meet this demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is recommended for generating model coefficients?
output: It is recommended that a broad set of cooling tower performance data be used to generate these model coefficients.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What must the air inlet node name be if there is no DOA Mixer in a unit ventilator?
output: The air inlet node name must be the zone exhaust node name if there is no DOA Mixer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the minimum value for the outdoor temperature for crankcase heater operation field?
output: The minimum value for this field is 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the Zone Ventilator Sensible Heating Energy?
output: This output is the sensible heat addition of the stand alone energy recovery ventilator to the zone in Joules over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What governs the availability of the unit?
output: Availability of the unit is governed by the availability schedule and by availability managers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Heating Water Outlet Node Name' field contain?
output: This field contains the name of the hot water outlet node to the radiant system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table row: PlantComponent:TemperatureSource
input: What is the parameter associated with PlantComponent:TemperatureSource?
output: Design Volume Flow Rate

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is assumed to be the same for beam-to-diffuse and diffuse-to-diffuse reflection?
output: It is assumed to be the same for beam-to-diffuse and diffuse-to-diffuse reflection.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: In which cases is the 'Water Use Equipment Heating Energy' reported with Resource Type = DistrictHeatingWater?
output: If the WaterUse:Equipment object is not included in WaterUse:Connections or modeled as stand-alone then this output is reported with Resource Type = DistrictHeatingWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the model not require?
output: The model does not require information about internal system architecture.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: When is the field for Cooling And Charge Mode required?
output: This field is required if Cooling And Charge Mode is available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the mode of operation for chillers 1 and 2?
output: Chillers 1 and 2 are in heat recovery mode and isolated from the ground source loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the electric power input to the ITE equipment CPU at design inlet conditions?
output: It is the total power input minus the cooling fan power if the air inlet temperature were held at the design condition.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What equation type is used for the 'Cooling Capacity Ratio Modifier Function of Low Temperature Curve Name'?
output: This curve is a bi-quadratic equation using weighted average indoor wet-bulb temperature and condenser entering air dry-bulb temperature as the independent variables.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Name' used for in the context of a Multizone ADU?
output: The 'Field: Name' is used to provide a unique name for the Multizone ADU.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What follows the first layer in a construction?
output: The next layer is a WindowMaterial:Gap layer and the following layers then alternate between WindowMaterial:Glazing or WindowMaterial:ComplexShade and WindowMaterial:Gap.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What does the output variable 'Room Air Zone Vertical Temperature Gradient [K/m]' represent?
output: This output variable is the result of the interpolation performed by the user-defined roomair model using RoomAir:TemperaturePattern:TwoGradient. This is the temperature gradient in the vertical direction. The units are degrees Kelvin per meter.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Outputs -> table row: People specific outputs
input: What is the output variable for zone average space people total heating rate?
output: ZoneAverageSpace People Total Heating Rate [W]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the alternative if the node name is specified in an OutdoorAir:NodeList object?
output: The outdoor air temperature is taken directly from the weather data.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Activity Level Schedule Name' field?
output: This field is the name of the schedule that determines the amount of heat gain per person in the zone under design conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Transmittance Schedule Name'?
output: The name of a schedule of solar transmittance values from 0.0 to 1.0 for the shading surface. If a blank is entered in this field the transmittance value defaults to 0.0 i.e. the shading surface is opaque at all times.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: When is the airflow rate field not used?
output: This field is not used when Condenser Type = Air Cooled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the range temperature is greater than the specified maximum?
output: If the range temperature is greater than this value the actual range temperature is still passed to the empirical model but a warning will be issued.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the restriction on the flow per cell when using MaximalCell?
output: The flow per cell will not be allowed to drop below its minimum value specified by the Minimum Water Flow Rate Fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How are the values for 'Heat Pump Load Side Inlet Temperature [C]' calculated?
output: The values are calculated for each HVAC system time step being simulated and the results are averaged for the time step being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: How does this object calculate a dry-bulb temperature setpoint?
output: It reads input PMV values from a given PMV setpoint schedule and uses them to calculate a dry-bulb temperature setpoint based on the selected thermal comfort model.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What does the UA curve apply to?
output: The UA curve applies to the exhaust gas heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the 'Zone Packaged Terminal Heat Pump Latent Heating Rate' value calculated?
output: This value is calculated as the difference between the total energy rate and the sensible energy rate provided by the packaged terminal heat pump.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How can a shade be assigned to a window or glass door?
output: To assign a shade to a window or glass door see WindowMaterial: Shade.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the HVAC output related to indoor pool miscellaneous equipment energy?
output: HVAC Sum Indoor Pool Miscellaneous Equipment Energy [J]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: How is the defrost schedule used if TemperatureTermination control type is used?
output: The defrost schedule is used for the defrost cycle start time and the defrost cycle end time is not allowed to extend beyond the scheduled off time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the Green Roof Cumulative Irrigation Depth?
output: Cumulative or current irrigation (m)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: How should the order of layers be listed in EnergyPlus?
output: The order of the remaining layers is important and should be listed in order of occurrence from the one just inside the outside layer until the inside layer is reached.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How should a condenser with evaporative media be modeled?
output: The user should specify Condenser Type = Evap Cooled and enter the appropriate evaporative effectiveness for the media.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: What happens if the 'Availability Schedule Name' field is left blank?
output: If this field is blank the evaporative cooler is always available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What happens if recovery to the setpoint is not achieved during the Recovery Efficiency test?
output: The Recovery Efficiency test will not compute properly because recovery to the setpoint was not achieved.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Schedules -> text
input: What does the group of objects in the 'Group -- Schedules' section allow the user to influence?
output: This group of objects allows the user to influence scheduling of many items such as occupancy density lighting thermostatic controls and occupancy activity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the unit for Zone Thermal Comfort Operative Temperature?
output: Zone Thermal Comfort Operative Temperature is measured in degrees Celsius [C].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What should be noted about the fan's maximum flow rate?
output: The fan's maximum flow rate should be the same as the maximum secondary air flow rate of the PIU.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the heat transfer energy for low temperature suction pipes in a transcritical system?
output: Refrigeration Transcritical System Low Temperature Suction Pipe Heat Transfer Energy is measured in Joules.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Should the sensible and total cooling capacities be gross or net?
output: Both the sensible and total cooling capacities used to define the Rated SHR should be gross (i.e. the effect of supply air fan heat is NOT accounted for).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: How must the unitary system's fan cooling coil heating coil and optional reheat coil be connected?
output: The unitary system's fan cooling coil heating coil and optional reheat coil must be connected in the air loop according to the configuration shown above (Figure 1).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> table or table row: Outputs of Lights Objects
input: What is the output variable for Zone Average Space Lights Return Air Heating Rate?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: Where can details on the equations used to calculate the Fanger PPD be found?
output: Details on the equations used to calculate the Fanger PPD are shown in the EnergyPlus Engineering Reference.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Companion Coil Used For Heat Recovery' specify?
output: When simulating a wrap-around heat recovery loop enter the name of the water coil connected to this coil system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does the field 'Extra Crack Length or Height of Pivoting Axis' specify for LVO Type 1?
output: For LVO Type 1 this field specifies the extra crack length in meters due to multiple openable parts in addition to the calculated length of cracks on the top bottom and sides.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What is the actuator variable currently limited to?
output: The actuator variable is currently limited to mass flow through a water coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What are the four allowed choices for Ventilation Control Mode?
output: The four allowed choices for Ventilation Control Mode are NoVent Temperature Enthalpy and Constant.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: According to Note 4 how are EER IEER and Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity calculated?
output: They will be calculated according to ANSI/AHRI standard 340-360 (2022) when the cooling capacity of the coil is between 65000 and 135000 Btu/hr.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: Why might a separate temperature calculation be important?
output: It might be important in a radiant cooling system where condensation could be a problem.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does 'Chiller Heater Heating Source Heat Transfer Rate (W)' represent?
output: The thermal energy consumption rate required for heating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Speed <x> Secondary Coil Air Flow Rate' field specify?
output: This input value is the secondary coil (evaporator) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in heating mode or the secondary coil (condenser) air flow rate when the heat pump is working in cooling mode. This input field is auto-sizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the Heater 2 Height?
output: 0 m

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> listing

output: AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:WindPressureCoefficientValues    NFacade_WPCValue    !- Name    Every 30 Degrees    !- AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:WindPressureCoefficientArray Name    0.60          !- Wind Pressure Coefficient

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Use Weather File Horizontal IR' specify?
output: This field specifies whether or not to use the horizontal infrared radiation values from weather files if presented.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the first coefficient for the full load ratio curve represent?
output: This numeric field contains the first coefficient for the full load ratio curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 10 Reference Unit Water Pump Input Power At Rated Conditions?
output: 10.0 dimensionless

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: How many reference points can there be in each zone when using the DElight Daylighting Method?
output: When the DElight Daylighting Method is used there may be up to a maximum of 100 reference points for each zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> equation
input: What is the equation format involving coefficients C1 C2 and C3?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What can be entered for heating air flow rate if the system does not have a heating coil?
output: If the system does not have a heating coil a 0 may be entered for heating air flow rate and/or no load supply air flow rate to turn the fan off when heating is not required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: How is the speed number determined in 'Field: Single Mode Operation'?
output: The speed number is determined by a system load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the unit for Space Hot Water Equipment Lost Heat Rate?
output: The unit for Space Hot Water Equipment Lost Heat Rate is Watts (W).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How is the maximum capacity adjusted in the 'Normalized Capacity Function of Temperature Curve Name' field?
output: The maximum capacity is adjusted from the rated conditions representing what the actual capacity the heat pump can achieve under the outdoor air temperature and the water temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Hybrid Model -> table or table row: Examples of the object in an IDF
input: What is the name of the HybridModel object in the example?
output: ZONE 1 HybridModel

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the Fuel Input Curve?
output: The Fuel Input Curve is a polynomial equation that determines the Ratio of Fuel Input to Energy Output. The equation combines both the Fuel Input Curve Coefficients and the Temperature Based Fuel Input Curve Coefficients.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table row: Maximum Water Flow Rate
input: What is the maximum water flow rate?
output: Maximum Water Flow Rate

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the calculation for the Indirect Water Heating Recovery Time field based on?
output: The calculation is based on log-mean temperature difference (LMTD) and includes the heat transfer effectiveness factor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group ExternalInterface -> text
input: What is recommended for the FMU file path for best results?
output: The field should include a full path with file name for best results.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: To what is the output of 'Cooling Coil <Fuel Type> Energy [J]' added?
output: This output is also added to a meter with Resource Type = <Fuel Type> End Use Key = Heating Group Key = System (ref. Output:Meter objects).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the unit for Hot Water Equipment Total Heating Rate?
output: The unit for Hot Water Equipment Total Heating Rate is Watts (W).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> listing
input: What is the IDF example for ZoneControl:ContaminantController?
output: ZoneControl:ContaminantController  CO2 Controller1         !- Name  EAST ZONE               !- Zone Name  CO2AvailSchedule        !- Carbon Dioxide Control Availability Schedule Name  CO2SetpointSchedule     !- Carbon Dioxide Setpoint Schedule Name                          !- Minimum Carbon Dioxide Concentration Schedule Name                          !- Maximum Carbon Dioxide Concentration Schedule Name  GCAvailSchedule         !- Generic Contaminant Control Availability Schedule Name  GCSetpointSchedule;      !- Generic Contaminant Setpoint Schedule Name

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the default flow rate if there is no sizing calculation?
output: The defaults are 0.000762 cubic meters per second per square meter of zone floor area (0.15 cfm/ft2) and 0.2 flow fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the upper limit for the boiler water outlet temperature?
output: The upper limit for the boiler water outlet temperature is 80°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the rated air volume flow rate range for the DX cooling coil evaporator section?
output: The rated air volume flow rate should be between 0.00004027 m³/s and 0.00006041 m³/s per Watt of gross rated total cooling capacity (300 to 450 cfm/ton).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the field 'Speed <x> Reference Unit Rated Water Flow Rate' contain?
output: This numeric field contains the reference volumetric water flow rate on the condenser at this specific speed level in volume flow rate units.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How is the Zone North Axis specified in EnergyPlus?
output: The Zone North Axis is specified relative to the Building North Axis with the value given in degrees where clockwise is positive.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the second fan coefficient value?
output: The second fan coefficient value is 1.1086242.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: What is the nominal thermal efficiency in the given boiler description?
output: The nominal thermal efficiency is indicated by the term 'LeavingBoiler'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the Zone VRF Air Terminal Latent Cooling Energy value describe?
output: This value describes the latent cooling energy delivered to the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Availability Schedule Name' field define?
output: It defines when the coil is available based on the schedule's value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What are the outputs listed in the document?
output: HVAC Average Unitary System Fan Part Load Ratio [] HVAC Average Unitary System Compressor Part Load Ratio [] HVAC Average Unitary System Dehumidification Induced Heating Demand Rate [W]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Layer 5 Solar Radiation Absorbed Schedule Name' specify?
output: The 'Field: Layer 5 Solar Radiation Absorbed Schedule Name' specifies the name of a schedule that contains absorbed solar radiation values in units of W/m² for the fifth layer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the default value for the 2017 Rated Evaporator Fan Power Per Volume Flow Rate if left blank?
output: The default value is 773.3 W/(m³/s) (365 W/1000 cfm).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the tilt angle?
output: The tilt angle is the angle (in degrees) that the wall is tilted from horizontal (or the ground).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What should be done if the baffle covers only part of a surface?
output: The surface should be split into separate BuildingSurface:Detailed objects where one matches the size of the baffle.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the maximum number of layers that can be specified for constructions in EnergyPlus?
output: Up to ten layers (eight for windows) may be specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How can a middle floor zone be modeled?
output: A middle floor zone can be modeled by making the floor the Outside Boundary Condition Object for the ceiling and the ceiling the Outside Boundary Condition Object for the floor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Suction Temperature Control Type' field if left blank?
output: If the field is blank the default will be ConstantSuctionTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What is the default value for the relaxation factor?
output: The default is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What is the default convergence tolerance?
output: The default is 0.001.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Outside Convection Coefficient' field?
output: This numeric field defines the outside convection coefficient (W/m²-K).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: What must the user do to model behavior using the API Callback approach?
output: The user will create a callback function for modeling the behavior and register the function using the runtime API function callback_user_defined_component_model.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does the 'Minimum Air Flow Turndown Schedule Name' field adjust?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What are the choices for the 'Field: Supply Air Fan Placement'?
output: This alpha field has two choices: BlowThrough or DrawThrough. If this field is left blank the default is blow through. The first choice stands for 'blow through fan' meaning the unit consists of a fan followed by the DX coils. The fan 'blows through' the cooling and heating coils. If an outside air mixer is used the fan inlet connects to the outdoor air mixer's mixed air node. If an outdoor air mixer is not used the fan inlet connects to the zone exhaust node. For this configuration the fan outlet always connects to the DX cooling coil inlet node (or if a DX cooling coil is not used the DX heating coil inlet node). The second choice stands for 'draw through fan' meaning the unit consists of the DX coil(s) followed by a fan. The fan 'draws air through' the DX coil(s). In this case the fan inlet always connects to the DX heating coil outlet node (or if a DX heating coil is not used the DX cooling coil outlet node) and the fan outlet node always connects to the zone inlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

This is determined by the current heat gain from the heater to the zone and the 'Fraction Radiant' specified in input (1-FractionRadiant = FractionConvected). The convective heat gain is added to the zone air heat balance directly.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does the AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Zone object allow?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: How much heat does a pilot light deliver to the tank water?
output: A pilot light would deliver most of its heat to the tank water accounting for thermal conversion efficiency possibly around 0.80.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What impact does the zone exhaust fan model have?
output: The zone exhaust fan model provides a way to include the electrical power used by the fan and can impact air flows in central air handlers by decreasing the flow of return air and sometimes increasing the outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What are the two potential ways to use other side coefficients?
output: Either they are used to set the temperature of the exterior side surface directly (if the combined convective/radiative coefficient is less than or equal to zero) or to set both the film coefficient (positive value for the combined convective/radiative coefficient) and the outside air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What are the valid choices for the vertical location of a refrigeration chiller?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text

output: A unique user-assigned name for an instance of a night ventilation availability manager.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Trench Length' specify?
output: This numeric field is the length of the heat exchanger trench in meters. This assumes the heat exchanger runs the full length of the trench.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How does EnergyPlus determine the height and width of a surface from detailed vertices?
output: EnergyPlus tries to determine the height and width of the surface from detailed vertices. For surfaces with more than 4 sides if the calculated height and width are not close to the gross area the height and width shown will be the square root of the area forming a square.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: How does the cool dense air behave in a cooltower?
output: The cool dense air naturally falls down through the shaft and leaves through large openings at the bottom of cooltowers.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What does the crown account for?
output: The crown accounts for curvature of the slat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What does the 'Source Zone or Space Name' field specify?
output: The 'Source Zone or Space Name' field specifies the name of the 'source' zone or space that exhausts the amount of air specified by the design level and schedule fields to the zone named in the zone name field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What requirement must curve names meet?
output: Curve names must be unique across all curve types.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

output: The options include 'timestep' and 'hourly'.

output: Every branch must have at least one component but it may have several components in series.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the default defrost model if the 'Heat Pump Defrost Control' field is left blank?
output: A blank field defaults to None.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What do the 'Zone Dehumidifier Electricity Rate [W]' and 'Zone Dehumidifier Electricity Energy [J]' outputs represent?
output: These outputs are the electric power and electric consumption of the dehumidifier for the time period being reported. They include all electricity used by the dehumidifier (including off-cycle electric parasitics). These values are calculated for each HVAC system timestep and the results are averaged (power) or summed (consumption) for the timestep being reported. The electric consumption output is also added to a meter with Resource Type = Electricity End Use Key = Cooling Group Key = System (ref. Output:Meter objects).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the default chilled water supply temperature lower limit in the field 'Chilled Water Temperature Lower Limit'?
output: The default is 2°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the Field: Coefficient 2 of the Steam Use Part Load Ratio Curve?
output: C2 in the Generator Heat Input Part Load Ratio Curve. This value is obtained by fitting manufacturers performance data to the curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> table
input: What are the outputs related to HVACSumChiller Evaporator Cooling Energy?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: How is the specified generic contaminant setpoint used?
output: The specified generic contaminant setpoint is used to calculate the required outdoor airflow rate through the HVAC system to reach the setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What does the Electric Storage Degradation Fraction output report?
output: This output reports the fractional battery life used up at a point of time. For example a value of 0.4 at the end of one year simulation means that 40% of the battery life is used up so the battery needs to be replaced every two and a half years.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> text
input: What does the 'Pipe Volume Flow Rate [m3/s]' output represent?
output: Fluid volumetric flow rate (mass flow rate / density).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What does the ZoneAirBalance:OutdoorAir model combine?
output: The model combines all outdoor airflows from ZoneInfiltration and ZoneVentilation objects in the same zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Use Side Design Flow Rate field?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> item

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What do the 'inside face system radiation heat gain' output variables describe?
output: These 'inside face system radiation heat gain' output variables describe the heat transferred by infrared thermal radiation onto the inside face that emanated from HVAC equipment such as baseboard heaters or high-temperature radiant heating panels.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the Design Vapor Inlet Temperature field represent?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group ExternalInterface -> text

output: This field is used to enter the emissivity of the back of PV module material. Usually not known. Default is 0.9. Unitless.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What outputs are available for condensers cooling systems serving cases and/or walk-ins?
output: ZoneAverage Refrigeration System Condenser Heat Transfer Rate [W] and Zone Sum Refrigeration System Condenser Heat Transfer Energy [J].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the outside boundary condition for 'OtherSideCoefficients'?
output: The outside boundary condition will be the name of the SurfaceProperty:OtherSideCoefficients specification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What is the default behavior if the 'End-Use Subcategory' field is omitted or left blank?
output: If this field is omitted or left blank the fan will be assigned to the 'General' end use subcategory.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: How does the model represent part-load operation if the capacity control is FanCycling?
output: The model assumes part-load operation is represented by a simple linear interpolation between two steady-state regimes.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What assumption does the model make about the rated heating capacity sizing ratio?
output: The model assumes that when used this value will be greater than 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the output type for 'Chiller COP'?
output: Chiller COP is measured in Watts per Watt [W/W].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: What happens if the thermal comfort control is specified as Uncontrolled for a particular period?
output: If the thermal comfort control is specified as Uncontrolled (thermal comfort control type value of 0) for a particular period then control will revert to thermostat control if specified. If thermostat control is not specified in the input then conditions will float.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the Irrigation Maximum Saturation Threshold field do?
output: It is used with the SmartSchedule option to override the default 40% saturation limit for turning off the irrigation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What are the valid values for the absorptance field?
output: Values for this field must be between 0.0 and 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: IDD Conventions -> text
input: What is the conversion factor from m3/MJ to ft3/kWh?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> table: 'Basic Model Wind Coefficient values'

output: Shelter class 1: 0.000319 Shelter class 2: 0.000246 Shelter class 3: 0.000174 Shelter class 4: 0.000104 Shelter class 5: 0.000032.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the unit for Zone Thermal Comfort CEN 15251 Adaptive Model Running Average Outdoor Air Temperature?
output: Zone Thermal Comfort CEN 15251 Adaptive Model Running Average Outdoor Air Temperature is measured in degrees Celsius [C].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> item
input: What is an output variable for Space Electric Equipment Convective Heating?
output: ZoneSumSpace Electric Equipment Convective Heating Energy [J]

output: The coefficient (A_18) in the equation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does 'Baseboard Air Outlet Temperature [C]' report?
output: This field reports the air temperatures at the outlet node of a baseboard unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What are the additional outputs for water-cooled chillers?
output: For water-cooled chillers: HVACAverageChiller Condenser Inlet Temperature [C] HVACAverageChiller Condenser Outlet Temperature [C] HVACAverageChiller Condenser Mass Flow Rate [kg/s].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What must you do with entries from the Optical Data Library before using them in EnergyPlus?
output: You will have to edit entries from this library to put them in the format required by the EnergyPlus WindowGlassSpectralData object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How are the results of latent heat extraction averaged?
output: The results (latent heat extraction only) are averaged for the time step being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What does the field 'Name' represent in the SetpointManager:Coldest?
output: A unique user-assigned name for an instance of a coldest setpoint manager. Anywhere in the input that this setpoint manager is used it is referred to by this name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What information does the 'Field: Chilled Water Inlet Node Name' provide?
output: This required alpha field contains the identifying name for the chiller chilled water side inlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What happens if 'Return Air Fraction Is Calculated from Plenum Temperature' is set to 'Yes'?
output: The return air fraction is calculated each timestep from an empirical correlation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the Field: Conductivity?
output: Thermal conductivity (W/m-K).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the name of the glass layer in an equivalent layer window construction?
output: The name of the glass layer. It corresponds to a layer in an equivalent layer window construction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Heating Design Capacity Method?
output: Enter the method used to determine the heating design capacity for scalable sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Energy Management System (EMS) -> text
input: Can the index variable name duplicate any other global scope EMS variable?
output: This name will be a global variable in Erl programs and cannot duplicate any other global scope EMS variable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> equation
input: How is the heating Thermal Energy Input to the chiller computed?
output: The heating Thermal Energy Input to the chiller is computed using the equation: TheoreticalFuelUse = BoilerLoad / NominalThermalEfficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is 'Field: Coefficient1 Constant' in a biquadratic curve?
output: The 'Field: Coefficient1 Constant' is the constant coefficient (C1) in the equation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What does a schedule value of zero indicate for ZoneVentilation:* and ZoneMixing objects?
output: Schedule values equal to zero indicate the individual ventilation control based on the control requirements from their own objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: Provide an example of how the cooling control temperature setpoint and throttling range affect the water flow rate.
output: For example if the cooling control temperature setpoint is currently 25 C and the cooling throttling range is 2 C the water flow rate to the radiant system will be zero when the controlling temperature is at or below 24 C and the maximum flow rate when the controlling temperature is at or above 26 C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What inputs define the MicroTurbine electric generator?
output: The following inputs define the MicroTurbine electric generator.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What is the default value for Design Power Consumption when the Design Power Sizing Method is set to PowerPerFlowPerPressure?
output: The default value is 1.282051 W/((m\(^3\)/s)-Pa).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What does selecting 'Heating' or 'Cooling' for the 'Coil Option Type' imply?
output: If either 'Heating' or 'Cooling' is selected only a heating or cooling coil respectively is present.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table: Design Objects
input: What is the design chilled water flow rate for the ChillerHeater:Absorption:DirectFired?
output: Design Chilled Water Flow Rate

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> table row: PerfLog Oscillation Columns
