instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the operation mode when a fixed temperature has been specified for cooling with coil?
output: The unit ventilator tries to use outdoor air as best as possible to meet the temperature goal. If it cannot meet this goal because the temperature goal is not between the zone return temperature and the outdoor air temperature then the unit ventilator will either use the maximum or minimum outdoor air flow rate in the same fashion as the fixed temperature outdoor air control for the 'no coil' conditions. The cooling coil then attempts to meet any remaining zone load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: How are the rigid media pads designed to handle mineral deposits?
output: The rigid media pads are designed to flush the mineral deposits to the sump so the saturation efficiency of the pad stays relatively constant.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the Chiller Heater Heating Part Load Ratio?
output: This is the average heating load (Chiller Heater Heating Rate [W]) divided by the average available heating capacity (Chiller Heater Maximum Heating Rate [W]) for the reported time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> listing

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is a packaged terminal heat pump (PTHP)?
output: The packaged terminal heat pump (PTHP) is a compound object made up of other components. Each PTHP consists of an outdoor air mixer direct expansion (DX) cooling coil DX heating coil supply air fan and a supplemental heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What is the purpose of the DesignSpecification:ZoneAirDistribution object?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: In what situations is indirect coupling more suited?
output: Indirect coupling is more suited to situations where room air is well controlled and/or the room air model is less robust.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the Field: Construction Name used for?
output: The Field: Construction Name is the name of the construction used in the surface and the full construction (all layers) is used regardless of location in the building.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> table row: Field: Current Aspect Ratio
input: What happens if the 'Field: Current Aspect Ratio' is set to 1.0?
output: If this field is set to 1.0 then the altered building will not necessarily have the new aspect ratio defined in the next field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

output: Average

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: What happens if the 'Water Pump Power Modifier Curve Name' field is left blank?
output: The pump power is assumed to vary linearly with the load including air system cycling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What does the MaxAllowedDelTemp variable set?
output: This variable sets the maximum surface temperature change before the HVAC timestep is shortened.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the Water Heater Compressor Part Load Ratio?
output: This output is the average part-load ratio of the heat pump water heater's compressor (as well as its water pump and fan) for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the output of the 'Speed <x> Energy Input Ratio Function of Temperature Curve Name' used?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: How does the ThermalStorage:ChilledWater:Stratified object solve the differential equations governing the energy balances on the nodes?
output: The object simultaneously solves the differential equations governing the energy balances on the nodes using a numerical method.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> equation

output: φ = \\frac\\dot m\\rho ND^3

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text

input: What is the Speed 3 Reference Unit Rated water flow rate?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the 'Zone Window Air Conditioner Latent Cooling Energy'?
output: This is the latent heat extraction of the window air conditioner unit from the zone it is serving in Joules over the timestep being reported. This is determined by the outlet and zone conditions and the mass flow rate through the unit.

output: This means that the unit consists of the DX coil(s) followed by a fan with the supplemental heater located at the outlet of the fan. The fan draws air through the DX coil(s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text

output: The second type is an extra setpoint especially for free heating that is managed within this object where the UTSC model looks at the zone air node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the result of the curve multiplied by?
output: The result of the curve is multiplied by Cooling And Charge Mode Rated Storage Charging Capacity to model capacity at temperatures away from the rating point.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> equation

output: S_f(t) = \\nu_dA_sm \\cdot C_f(t)\\cdot 10^-6 \\cdot F_R

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: What does the Outside Air System handle?
output: It handles the mixed air portion of the primary air system: the system relief air the outside air inlet and any components and controllers associated with the system relief air and outside air streams.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: How are suction piping heat gains calculated?
output: Suction piping heat gains are calculated based on the air temperature within the zone where the suction piping is located.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text

output: There is a meter associated with the resource type ElectricityProduced that increases the metered electricity production to account for power that has come back out of storage.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the cooling capacity for the cooling only mode sized?
output: The cooling capacity for the cooling only mode is sized to meet the air system's final design cooling capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the Chiller Heater Cooling Part Load Ratio?
output: This is the average cooling load (Chiller Heater Evaporator Cooling Rate [W]) divided by the average available cooling capacity (Chiller Heater Maximum Cooling Rate [W]) for the reported time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the AFN Zone Ventilation Sensible Heat Loss Energy?
output: The average convective sensible heat loss in Joules to the zone air corresponding to the Zone Ventilation flows from AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:DetailedOpening AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:SimpleOpening and AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:HorizontalOpening only averaged over the reporting period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How is the 'Zone Opaque Surface Inside Face Conduction' calculated for a zone with specific conduction values?
output: For example if a zone has six opaque surfaces with values of 100 -200 400 50 150 and -300 W the conduction is calculated as 700 - 500 = 200 W. Alternatively with values of -100 -200 400 -50 150 and -300 W it is calculated as 550 - 650 = -100 W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the Zone Ventilator Latent Cooling Rate calculated?
output: This value is calculated as the difference between the total energy rate and the sensible energy rate provided by the stand alone ERV.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Inputs -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the LeavingSetpointModulated mode do?
output: LeavingSetpointModulated changes the chiller model to internally vary the flow rate so that the temperature leaving the chiller matches a setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Control -> text
input: How does the controller dispatch equipment once the operation mode is determined?
output: Once the mode of operation is determined the controller dispatches the equipment based on the inputs for the operation scheme and equipment lists input for that mode using the current load on the primary plant side.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Supply Air Fan Name' field?
output: This field is the name of a fan that is part of the unit ventilator system and links the unit ventilator to particular fan data entered elsewhere in the input data file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: When is the AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:WindPressureCoefficientArray object required?
output: It is required if Wind Pressure Coefficient Type = INPUT in the AirflowNetwork:SimulationControl object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the range and default value for the Discharge Coefficient for Opening Factor 1?
output: The range is greater than 0.0 to less than or equal to 1.0 and the default value is 0.001.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Should the gross rated sensible cooling capacity account for the effect of supply air fan heat?
output: No the gross rated sensible cooling capacity should not account for the effect of supply air fan heat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the Field 8 for the schedule 'TurndownMinAirFlowSch'?
output: The Field 8 for 'TurndownMinAirFlowSch' is 'For: Weekends Holidays CustomDay1 CustomDay2'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: How is control accomplished in this component?
output: Control is accomplished by throttling the chilled water flow to the device.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What happens to skin gains when used with a zone in the ThermalStorage:ChilledWater:Mixed object?
output: When used with a zone the skin gains are removed from the zone heat balance as negative internal heat gains.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What happens if the 'Availability Schedule Name' field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the schedule has a value of 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What are the zone meter outputs for heat rejection energy transfer?
output: ZoneMeterHeatRejection:EnergyTransfer [J]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the coefficient3 x**2 for the OUCondTempCurve?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the under case HVAC return air fraction determine?
output: The under case HVAC return air fraction determines the portion of the case credits that directly impact the HVAC return air conditions (with the remainder of the case credits impacting the zone sensible and latent loads).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What should the capacity include for the Cooling And Charge Mode Rated Storage Charging Capacity?
output: The capacity should be net meaning any ancillary equipment inside the package needed for charging is included.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Performance Tables -> text
input: What does 'Performance Curve Output Value' represent?
output: The current value of the performance table. Performance curves and tables use the same output variable. This value is averaged over the time step being reported. Inactive or unused performance curves will show a value of -999 (e.g. equipment is off a specific performance curve is not required for this aspect of the equipment model at this time step etc.). This value means that the performance curve was not called during the simulation and therefore not evaluated. This inactive state value is only set at the beginning of each environment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What does 'Water Use Equipment Hot Water Temperature' indicate?
output: The temperature of hot water supplied to the equipment in units of degrees Celsius (C).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the default value for 'Ratio of Compressor Size to Total Compressor Capacity' if both this and the previous field are left blank?
output: The default value is 0.5.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What happens if the standard density supply air volume flow rate matches the system maximum supply air mass flow rate?
output: The resulting output from the model will exactly match the original performance data specified in each table.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> listing
input: What is the total efficiency of the supply fan in the unitary system example?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Secondary Coil Compressor Part Load Ratio represent?
output: It represents the compressor part load ratio when the heat pump is operating in heating mode and the secondary coil is extracting heat from a zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> listing
input: What does the 'RunPeriod' listing in the document illustrate?
output: The 'RunPeriod' listing illustrates an example of a winter simulation setup in EnergyPlus.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the air inlet node for the heating coil in the unitary system?
output: The heating coil air inlet node is 'Heating Coil Air Inlet Node'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text
input: What does the 'Thermal Working Fluid Type' field represent?
output: This field is the user's choice for the type of fluid used to collect thermal energy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the output variable for the average high stage compressor electricity rate in a refrigeration air chiller system?
output: HVACAverageRefrigeration Air Chiller System Total High Stage Compressor Electricity Rate [W]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How does the 'Speed <x> Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function of Flow Fraction Curve Name' field affect the sensible heat ratio?
output: The value of this curve modifies the nominal sensible heat ratio for the current time step depending on the secondary coil air flow fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What metrics are calculated and reported for the CoolingEffectASH55 model?
output: Elevated Air Speed Cooling Effect Cooling Effect Adjusted PMV and Cooling Effect Adjusted PPD are calculated and reported at each time step.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Reference Cooling Mode Leaving Condenser Water Temperature'?
output: The default value is 35.0°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the purpose of the cooling energy input ratio modifier curve for low part-load ratios?
output: The output of this curve is multiplied by the reference full-load EIR (inverse of the reference COP) and the other EIR Curves (e.g. EIR as Function of Temperature Curve EIR Defrost curve etc) to give the EIR at the specific temperatures and part-load ratio at which the equipment is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the Field: Construction Name represent?
output: This is the name of the subsurface's construction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What is the name of the DesignSpecification:ZoneAirDistribution?
output: DSZADO1

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What does the AirflowNetwork group consist of?
output: The AirflowNetwork group consists of AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:DetailedOpening and AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:SimpleOpening objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What causes infiltration according to the ZoneInfiltration:EffectiveLeakageArea model?
output: Infiltration is generally caused by the opening and closing of exterior doors cracks around windows and even in very small amounts through building elements.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Dehumidifier Part Load Ratio []' output field indicate?
output: This output field is the part-load ratio for the dehumidifier. Part-load ratio is defined as the water removal load to be met (kg/s) divided by the dehumidifier's water removal rate (kg/s) at the current operating conditions. This value is calculated for each HVAC system timestep and the results are averaged for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What are the minimum and maximum values for the back side beam-beam visible reflectance?
output: The minimum value is 0.0 and the maximum value is less than 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: Can an ambient zone be connected for skin losses in the AirTerminal:SingleDuct:UserDefined object?
output: Yes an ambient zone can be connected for skin losses to be treated as separate internal gains.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How are sensible/latent capacity splits determined in the DX cooling coil model?
output: Sensible/latent capacity splits are determined by the rated sensible heat ratio (SHR) and the apparatus dewpoint/bypass factor (ADP/BF) approach.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What must be specified regardless of the method chosen for defining fluid cooler performance?
output: Regardless of which method is chosen the design airflow rate and corresponding fan power must be specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What do the outputs 'Inverter Ancillary AC Electricity Rate' and 'Inverter Ancillary AC Electricity Energy' represent?
output: These outputs are the Alternating Current electricity consumed by the inverter. These are ancillary or night tare loss power uses by the inverter and modeled as if powered by the building's grid connection.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the choice field 'SCWH Mode Load Matching Type' specify?
output: This choice field specifies the control in the SCWH mode. The choices are CoolingLoad or WaterHeatingLoad.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What happens if the maximum heating design flow rate calculated using input fields is greater than the design heating flow rate calculated during sizing?
output: If the maximum heating design flow rate calculated using these input fields is greater than the design heating flow rate calculated during sizing these input fields have no impact on sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'Supply Air Fan Object Type' field specify in a unit ventilator?
output: This field specifies the type of supply air fan used by this unit ventilator.

output: This object defines the construction for equivalent layer window (ASHWAT) model.

input: What is the conversion factor from GJ to ton-hrs?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text

output: It indicates the total daylight illuminance at the first reference point from all of the windows in a daylit zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What happens if Multiplier > 1 regarding shadowing and solar radiation distribution?
output: You will get a warning if Solar Distribution = FullExterior or FullInteriorAndExterior indicating that the shadowing on the input window or the interior solar radiation distribution from the input window may not be representative of the actual group of windows.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the field 'Ratio of Rated Heating Capacity to Rated Cooling Capacity' contain?
output: This numeric field contains the ratio of rated heating capacity to the rated cooling capacity. It is used to determine the autosized rated heating capacity from the rated cooling capacity. It is also used to determine the autosized rated cooling capacity when peak heating loads are dominating during sizing calculations. If both this object's and its associated cooling coil's capacity are provided by the user this field not used. Typical value for this field depends on the application in which the coils are used. Here are some suggested values: 1.23 for water loop applications 0.89 for ground water applications and 0.76 for ground loop applications (source: 2021 AHRI directory).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What should the rated air volume flow rate be per watt of gross rated heating capacity?
output: The rated air volume flow rate should be between .00004027 m³/s and .00006041 m³/s per watt of gross rated heating capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What does the Electric Storage Total Voltage output represent?
output: This output is the total terminal voltage of the battery bank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What does the heat exchanger performance name field contain?
output: This alpha field contains the identifying name of the specific heat exchanger performance type object (e.g. HeatExchanger:Desiccant:BalancedFlow:PerformanceDataType1) that defines the performance for this heat exchanger. A single heat exchanger performance type object may be used to define performance for many HeatExchanger:Desiccant:BalancedFlow objects (i.e. the same name may be used in this input field for more than one balanced flow desiccant heat exchanger).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What is the nominal value of soil moisture content at saturation used for?
output: A nominal value of soil moisture content at saturation is used in evaluating thermal properties of freezing soil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Minimum Outdoor Dry-Bulb Temperature for Compressor Operation field define?
output: The Minimum Outdoor Dry-Bulb Temperature for Compressor Operation field defines the minimum outdoor air dry-bulb temperature where the cooling coil compressor turns off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What inputs are required for the VRF DX heating coil?
output: The VRF DX heating coil input requires an availability schedule the gross rated heating capacity and the rated air volume flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text

output: More information on curve types can be found in the section on Curves.

output: Volume output is added to a meter with Resource Type = OnSiteWater End Use Key = Condensate Group Key = System.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text

output: The numeric field specifies the ground cover effects used in the evapotranspiration model at the ground surface heat balance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What happens if the 'No Load Supply Air Flow Rate' is set to zero or left blank?
output: The model assumes that the supply air flow rate when no cooling/heating is needed is equal to the supply air flow rate when the cooling or heating coil was last operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Zone or ZoneList Name' specify in ZoneControl:Thermostat?
output: The 'Field: Zone or ZoneList Name' specifies the name of the zone or set of zones that is being controlled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What are the DOE-2 default infiltration coefficients?
output: In DOE-2 (the other EnergyPlus predecessor) the air change method defaults are (adjusted to SI units) 0 0 0.224 (windspeed) 0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: How does the SetpointManager:MultiZone:MinimumHumidity:Average calculate the average supply air humidity ratio?
output: It detects the air humidity level in multiple controlled zones served by the HVAC air loop and uses air/moisture mass balances to calculate an average supply air humidity ratio needed to maintain the zone relative humidity levels near their respective humidifying setpoints.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the AFN Zone Off Cycle Pressure?
output: This is the AirflowNetwork zone total pressure in Pa with respect to outdoor barometric pressure when the air distribution system fan is not operating (OFF).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> table or table row: Water-cooled Chillers Outputs

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Hybrid Model -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
